name: appall
content:

to make someone have strong feelings of shock or of disapproval: I was appalled at/by the lack of staff in the hospital. The state of the kitchen appalled her. Synonyms
horrify
scandalize
More examplesFewer examplesHe witnessed some appalling acts of barbarism during the war.Conditions in the prison are said to be appalling.Your table manners are appalling - don't you know how to use a knife and fork?After her appalling behavior, we had no option but to dismiss her.The standard of cleanliness in some of these restaurants is frankly appalling.
